sen.j: 重明親王（しげあきらしんのう、延喜6年（906年） - 天暦8年9月14日（954年10月13日））は、醍醐天皇第四皇子。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Shigeakira (906 - October 13, 954) was the forth prince of Emperor Daigo.

sen.j: その後は延長6年（928年）上野国太守、同8年（930年）弾正尹、承平7年（937年）に弾正尹を辞職の後中務卿を歴任、天慶6年（943年）三品に序され、その後式部卿となった。
sen.e: After that, he served as the governor of Kozuke Province in 928 and as danjo no kami in 930, continued to serve as nakatsukasa kyo after resigned from danjo no kami in 937, given a title of sanbon (the third of Imperial Princes' rank) in 943, and became shikibu kyo afterward.

sen.j: 皇位を巡る争いとは生涯無縁であったが、学識豊かで楽才にも優れた風流人であり、父醍醐天皇は崩御の間際に重明親王を代明親王共々召して遺詔を託した。
sen.e: He never had disputes over imperial throne, but he had great attainments and refined taste with excellent musical talent, so his father, Emperor Daigo, left him a will at the presence of both Imperial Prince Shigeakira and Imperial Prince Yoshiakira in Emperor Daigo's last moment.

sen.j: また異母弟村上天皇の宮中でもことに重んじられて、宴などでは必ず和琴や笛に加わった。
sen.e: Also, his half brother, Emperor Murakami, was much accounted in the Imperial Palace and always played thirteen-stringed koto and a flute at a banquet.

sen.j: 摂関家との関係も良好で、始めに太政大臣藤原忠平の娘藤原寛子と結婚、天慶8年（945年）に寛子が死去すると、天暦2年（948年）に寛子の姪にあたる藤原登子を後妻としている。
sen.e: His relationship with the clan[family] eligible for regents was good, so he first married to a daughter, FUJIWARA no Kanshi (Hiroko), of the Grand Minister, FUJIWARA no Tadahira, and he remarried to FUJIWARA no Toshi (Nariko), who was Kanshi (Hiroko)'s niece after Kanshi(Hiroko)'s death.

sen.j: 重明親王は一風変わった逸話の多い人物で、日輪が家に入り鳳凰が飛来する夢を見て、将来帝位に関わる兆しかと期したという伝説がある。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Shigeakira had a lot of unusual anecdotes, and there was a legend that he dreamed a phoenix flying when the sun came into the house, so he expected it was the sign to get involved in crown in the future.

sen.j: また『今昔物語』に登場する話では、東三条殿の庭園に怪しい太った五位が夜な夜な姿を見せるので、親王が怪しんで陰陽師に占わせると東南の隅から銅の提（ひさげ）が現れ、以後五位は姿を見せなくなったという。
sen.e: In addition, the story in "Konjaku monogatari (Tales of Times Now Past)" told that suspicious fat night heron appeared every night in the garden of Higashi sanjo dono, so Imperial Prince made a yin-yang diviner divine, and a copper hisage (a Japanese sake bottle) appeared from the corner of south-east, then night heron never appeared since then.

sen.j: なお親王の日記『吏部王記』は原本も写本も現存しないが、後世の日記や書物に引用された逸文から見て、朝議に関する詳細な記録を書き留めたものであったらしく、当時の朝廷の儀式・典礼に関する貴重な史料である。
sen.e: Also, for Imperial Prince's diary "Ribu (Rihi) O ki," an original book and a duplicate copy do not exist at the present, but the excellent document referred from the later diary and document, it seemed that it was the detailed report of the conference at Imperial Court, and it is the valuable historical records on ceremony and ritual of Imperial Court.

Also, as forthe Imperial Prince's diary "Ribu (Rihi) O ki," the original book and a duplicate copy does not exist at present, but from an excellent document about the diary, it seems that it was a detailed report of a conference at the Imperial Court, and is a valuable historical record on ceremonies and rituals of the Imperial Court.

Also, although the original manuscript for Ribuoki (also pronounced Rihioki), the diary of Imperial Prince Shigeakira, has not survived and no copies are presently known to exist, extracts from it that appear in later diaries and documents suggest that it included detailed reports on conferences held at the Imperial Court, providing a valuable historical record of the ceremonies and rituals practiced at the Imperial Court at that time.
